episode_summary: This episode features a variety of quirky and intriguing facts, including the last case of scurvy in the Royal Navy, a unique Vietnamese noodle dish, the history of the Ashes cricket trophy, and the peculiarities of Hawaiian monk seals.

facts.fact: The last case of scurvy in the British Royal Navy was in the 1970s.
Cao Láº§u is a Vietnamese noodle dish that can only be made in the town of Hoi An because it requires water from a specific well and ash from a local tree.
The Ashes, the trophy for the cricket series between England and Australia, originated from a satirical obituary published in 1882 that declared the death of English cricket.
Hawaiian monk seals keep getting eels stuck up their noses, possibly due to regurgitation or defensive eel behavior.
